page.title: 04ST.MARY'S CHURCH DUNSFORD
page.content: The first church in Dunsford was dedicated in 1261 but the present building was erected between 1420 and 1455.The font is origional,about 1430. Three windows in the North Aisle have some very old glass displaying shields of Moreton and Bosum and the figures of St.Helena,St.Barbara and St. Catherine.This aisle contains the Fulford family pew which was at one time a side chapel.The pew contains a very fine monument to Thomas Fulford and his family.The bells were cast in 1785 and have been recast and rehung in a steel frame in 1978.The gallery is Jacobean.It was strengthened by a 30 ft.oak beam grown in Powderham Park and two under the organ,with a cross beam resting on oak pillars between the original stone pillars.
